distribution.text: Copyright 2024 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
This update for libxml2 fixes the following issues:

Update to 2.9.14:

- CVE-2022-29824: Fixed integer overflow that could have led to an out-of-bounds write in buf.c (xmlBuf*) and tree.c (xmlBuffer*) (bsc#1199132).

Update to version 2.9.13:

- CVE-2022-23308: Fixed a use-after-free of ID and IDREF attributes. (bsc#1196490)
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: In libxml2 before 2.9.14, several buffer handling functions in buf.c (xmlBuf*) and tree.c (xmlBuffer*) don't check for integer overflows. This can result in out-of-bounds memory writes. Exploitation requires a victim to open a crafted, multi-gigabyte XML file. Other software using libxml2's buffer functions, for example libxslt through 1.1.35, is affected as well.
notes.title: CVE description
